intro: Cottendorfia argentea, commonly known as the silverleaf cottendorfia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the genus. Cottendorfia argentea thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas and rocky outcrops.
